infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface EntropyCalculator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EntropyCalculatorGaussian, EntropyCalculatorKernel

    public interface EntropyCalculator
    Interface for implementations of entropy estimators on continuous univariate data (ie double[] arrays).

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator initialise();
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using: setObservations(double[]);
    5. Compute the entropy using: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of calculator-specific parameters Clears any PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set properties for the underlying calculator implementation. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        No general properties are defined at the interface level, i.e. there are only calculator-specific properties.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[] observations)
        Sets the samples from which to compute the PDF for the entropy. Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Parameters:
        observations - array of (univariate) samples

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the entropy from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the entropy estimate

      • setDebug

        void setDebug(boolean debug)
        Set or clear debug mode for extra debug printing to stdout
        Parameters:
        debug - new setting for debug mode (on/off)
